title: Model SAE collapse again
body:
## Expected behavior

I'm training model SAE using the prebuild windows app (Version: 2019.4.24 DeepFaceLabCUDA10.1AVX) with the configurations as follow:
===== Model summary =====
== Model name: SAE
== Current iteration: 87551
== Model options:
== |== write_preview_history : True
== |== batch_size : 12
== |== sort_by_yaw : False
== |== random_flip : True
== |== resolution : 128
== |== face_type : f
== |== learn_mask : True
== |== optimizer_mode : 2
== |== archi : df
== |== ae_dims : 512
== |== e_ch_dims : 42
== |== d_ch_dims : 21
== |== multiscale_decoder : False
== |== ca_weights : True
== |== pixel_loss : True
== |== face_style_power : 0.0
== |== bg_style_power : 0.0
== |== remove_gray_border : False
== Running on:
== |== [0 : GeForce GTX 1060 6GB]


## Actual behavior

The loss goes high suddenly and the preview image goes red(src) and black(dst), and can't get down anymore.
[14:45:14][#088303][2010ms][2.9678][12.7739]
![PreviewWindow](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/8458250/56845915-f0a57a00-68fa-11e9-9bb2-f3794fe2c21a.png)
I can provide my model file if it's needed, thank you!

## Steps to reproduce

Don't know the cause clearly, but it seems that when the iteration count goes high, it's more likely to collapse.

## Other relevant information
Command: trainSAE.bat
Software: The prebuild windows app (Version: 2019.4.24 DeepFaceLabCUDA10.1AVX) 
Operating System: Windows 10
